DOC.brief_summary: This randomized phase I trial study at-home group video call session quality life rural patient breast cancer . At-home group video call support session may improve well-being quality life woman breast cancer
DOC.brief_title: Phase I : At-Home Support Rural Women Using Group Video Calling
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To examine whether deliver at-home professionally-led breast cancer support use group video call feasible , acceptable satisfactory woman rural northern California . II . To evaluate feasibility use on-line tool recruit , screen , treat , assess population subsequent randomize clinical trial . III . Assess whether rate recruitment woman region study use predominantly on-line mean recruitment improve previous study use predominantly face-to-face mean recruitment . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Estimate effect size change measure quality life ( post-traumatic stress disorder symptom , depression symptom , perceive stress , positive state mind ) , satisfaction social support , self-efficacy cop cancer . II . Prescribe sample size . III . Perform I II outcomes . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 treatment arm . ARM I ( experimental arm ) : Participants complete at-home group video call session 1 1/2 hour weekly 8 week . ARM II ( control arm ) : Participants receive educational workbook journal . After completion study treatment , participant follow 1 week .
